alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Iowa; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 12:03PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cedar, Johnson, north central Washington, southwestern Jones, northwestern Muscatine, southern Linn and southeastern Iowa Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Walford to near Oxford to Wellman. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cedar Rapids, Coralville, North Liberty, Fairfax, Tiffin and Swisher around 1210 PM CDT. Shueyville and Lake Macbride State Park around 1215 PM CDT. Marion, Solon and Ely around 1220 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include University Heights, Hills, Bertram, Oakdale, Iowa City, Mount Vernon, Lisbon, Springville, Whittier, Viola, West Branch and Martelle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 230 and 253. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Iowa; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Muscatine; Washington
